summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel on July 10, 2019, discussing the potential need to execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence for digital media and computer equipment. The email notes that most of the sender's squad is in Florida interviewing victims, and assistance from other squads is requested.

persons.name: Watson, Sean P.
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting assistance for a potential search warrant execution at Epstein's residence. He identifies himself as SSA of the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in FBI New York.

events.title: Potential Search Warrant Execution at Epstein's Residence
events.description: The FBI may execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence for digital media and computer equipment.

events.title: FBI Squad in Florida Interviewing Victims
events.description: Most of SSA Watson's FBI squad is reported to be in Florida conducting victim interviews related to the Epstein case.

locations: Epstein's residence (location unspecified in this email)
keyFacts: On July 10, 2019, the FBI was planning a potential search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence for digital media and computer equipment.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York was leading this effort, but most of its agents were in Florida interviewing victims.
The email shows active, multi-state investigation into Epstein by the FBI in July 2019, focusing on digital evidence and victim testimony.
